intro: Veronica tianschanica, commonly known as the Tianshan speedwell, is a flowering plant native to the Tianshan mountain range in Central Asia. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features small, blue or purple flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Veronica tianschanica is adapted to rocky and alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sunlight.
